Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: cozydiver
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and you cant beat the price! My wife and I are from Carlsbad but now live in Arizona. Typically we stay with family or friends when we’re in town but now that we have a little girl (1 ½ yrs old) we find it easier for us, and our family, to have our own space. Growing up in Carlsbad I’ve always noticed this hotel tucked away in the cul-de-sac but never really gave any notice. Now that they have remodeled the exterior and interior they’ve turned this once drab space in to a shining gem. As my title says its all about location and this hotel has it. Walking distance to everything Carlsbad has to offer. It’s a bit of a distance to the beach so if you’re trucking all your kids stuff, and in my case, kids stuff, and my surfboard. My suggestion is bring a folding wagon or cart. That might be a good thing the hotel could offer their guest. Have a couple wagons on hand to loan out to guest with families. Hopefully they read this and pick up a few of them at Costco. As far as the rooms they were very nice. I noticed a couple things they could have improved which is the reason I’m giving them a 4 rather then a 5 rating. If you’re going to update an entire hotel with new furniture, carpet, paint and so on. Why not get rid of the dirty popcorn ceilings? Yes I know there is extra cost involved, but to have all brand new then look up to see an old, dirty popcorn ceiling threw me off. The other thing that stood out to me was the bed. They had new, modern looking bedding but no bed skirt. The box spring was a bit beat and it really stood out. This is an easy fix which would make the room so much nicer. The rest of the room was great. The kitchen came in handy since we had the baby and could easily fix her meals. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel doesn’t have a regular cleaning schedule so if you want your room turned its by request. We never requested the cleaning service but did request towels and dish soap for the kitchen now and then. They were there in a flash with no waiting. If you’re like us and arriving via your own car I would suggest bringing your bikes if you have them. The hotel is walking distance to just about everything but next time we’re bringing the bikes for sure. There are a couple places in town that rent bikes for the day or week so that’s always an option as well. We had a great stay at Extended Stay and will definitely be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “The best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Edsan_12
Reviews.Content: Very clean and courteous staff. Grab and go breakfast works well for the on the go traveller. Very near the beach. Pool onsite is also a big plus for the kids. There is also a fitness center onsite for those who want to exercise. Parking is also abundant.

Reviews.Title: “New construction, but spartan accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Lestertheinvestor
Reviews.Content: Smoke seems to permeate the room, even though smoke free according to clerk. Pet friendly, with dogs all over. However, if you don't want to share your hotel with animals, this is not so pleasant. The pool is nice, but no hot tub/spa. Not sure of the ratings, but only soap is provided in the bathroom, without shampoo/conditioner. Small kitchen is nice. Beds are firm, but seem to be beaten up already, for a newly renovated/constructed hotel is surprising. Free breakfast munchies are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but disheartening”
Reviews.Author: P L
Reviews.Content: I booked a vaction through a travel agency and we decided since we'd be there a week we'd try an Extended Stay, good value, and a very nice piece of property. We landed around 8:30 pm and got our car and drove to the hotel. When we arrived we were tired from our flight and just wanted to go to sleep (due to the 3 hour time change coming from NJ). We got the lobby and we smelled smoke, no big deal. When we got to the reception area check-in was quick and she was very pleasant, then she said it and this is the only reason I gave 4 and not 5 points. She said the lobby is closing soon and if you have any problems call the police. Well my wife (holding our 4 year old song) her eyes bugged clear out of her head! When we got back to our room I got hit with 20 questions. "What did she mean?" "What problems will we have?" "Does she know something?" I calmed her down and we enjoyed our evening. I am not mad at her, or the hotel I actually appreciate the warning.

Reviews.Title: “Beach trip for a good value”
Reviews.Author: LMC76
Reviews.Content: Nice value for beach trip. Rooms have lots of space. Carlsbad is our favorite family beach town. Front staff could use some more help. Staff was covering desk, cleaning towels, and prep for grab and go breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very unclean!”
Reviews.Author: bngladbach
Reviews.Content: We had a list of things that were terrible about this hotel but the few basic things that were wrong are as follows: dirty linens were left in the sofa bed, dried blood on pillow, dirty towel in kitchen cupboard, hair and bobby pin on the floor, we're very understaffed, breakfast was always running out of items. Would never stay here again. Also just be advised there is no daily maid service at these hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well appointed room”
Reviews.Author: elwitty
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at this hotel on a hotwire rate and I was pleased. It does not have a ton of bells and whistles but the bed was comfortable, the room was clean, and it was fairly updated. The room served its purpose and they offered breakfast snacks. It was a good stay and I would do it again.

HotelInfo.Name: Extended Stay America San Diego - Carlsbad Village By The Sea
HotelInfo.Address: 1050 Grand Avenue, San Diego, CA 92008
